coiaf 0.1.0
  • Reference

Process real data

Source: R/process.R
process_real.Rd

Generate the COI curve for real data.

process_real(wsaf, plaf, seq_error = NULL, bin_size = 20, coi_method = "1")

Arguments

wsaf

The within-sample allele frequency.
plaf

The population-level allele frequency.
seq_error

The level of sequencing error that is assumed. If no value is inputted, then we infer the level of sequence error.
bin_size

The minimum size of each bin of data.
coi_method

The method we will use to calculate the theoretical COI. The method is either "1" or "2". The default value is "1".

Value

A list of the following:

  • data: A tibble with

  • plaf_cut: Breaks of the form [a, b).

  • m_variant: The average WSAF or proportion of variant sites in each segment defined by plaf_cut.

  • bucket_size: The number of loci in each bucket.

  • midpoints: The midpoint of each bucket.

  • seq_error: The sequence error inferred.

  • bin_size: The minimum size of each bin.

  • cuts: The breaks utilized in splitting the data. of each COI.

Details

The function computes whether a SNP is a variant site or not, based on the simulated WSAF at that SNP. This process additionally accounts for potential sequencing error.

See also

process_sim() to process simulated data.

Contents

Developed by Aris Paschalidis, OJ Watson.
